intro: Endodia lenticularis, commonly known as the lens-shaped lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Verrucariaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, lens-shaped thallus that is typically light to dark brown in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and an alga or cyanobacterium, which allows it to thrive in a variety of substrates, including soil, bark, and rock. It is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to grow in both moist and dry environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to mycologists and ecologists studying lichen diversity.
